ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It is a great course if you are interested in orientalism, nationalism and historiography. I will definitely recommend the course both to my classmates and to the coming students to my program.
HSAR 579 is a fantastic introduction to issues of contemporary global architecture, and I would definitely recommend it because it covers material rarely discussed in other settings.

Yes, it is a great course to investigate and understand a different cultural region outside of the western framework. I think that the content of the class provides an opportunity to study a different branch of modernism in which analysis and approach can either enlighten an existing focus of research, or provide the means towards a new topic of investigation.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It was directly related with my own research topic, so it was a great opportunity for me to discuss these concepts with the instructor and classmates.
This course provided a new set of references and tools for future investigations both in my personal research, and also in the understanding of my discipline.
